Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Chem-KVL (Synthetic AMPs, Val-rich, Leu-rich, XXE, XXA, UCLL1c; Stapled peptides: SCL-1, SCL-2, SCL-3, SCL-4, SCL-5, SCL-6, SCL-7)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (50%) toBombinin H-BO1V=L: 29%, G=K=R: 14%.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC 17978 (MIC 16 ug/ml),  S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 16 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae ATCC 13883 (MIC 16 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 32 ug/ml), and S. typhimurium clinical isolates (MIC 32 ug/ml).Peptide engineering: introducing one (i, i+4) type staple to the peptide increased peptide helicity and stability in serum. Of note, these staples increased peptide activity primarily against S. aureus and P. aeruginosa with MIC as low as 4 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Zhen B, Geng C, Yang Y, Liang H, Jiang Y, Li X, Ye G.2024
Literature Information.Reference: Bioorg Med Chem Lett. 2024 May 10:129794. doi: 10.1016/j.bmcl.2024.129794.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Systematic alanine and stapling mutational analysis of antimicrobial peptide Chem-KVL
